channel.title: 718 Chatbox Interface

item.title: 718 Chatbox Interface
item.dc:creator: @FolkDiss FolkDiss
item.description:
@FolkDiss wrote:

Hey, I know this is possible but it doesn’t seem to work for me. On just about every 718+ server, when a chatbox interface is displayed, a player can be in the very middle of an extensively long dialogue and he or she can accidently click somewhere on the interface (other than the “click here to continue” button) and that player will walk to wherever he or she clicked as if an interface wasn’t even displayed thus closing the interface. I was wondering if somebody can help me resolve this?

I want it so that if a chatbox interface is displayed, a player can’t just click through it and accidently walk every which way, he or she will have to click the MINIMAP in order to walk, like RuneScape. I understand how to do this, but for some reason it’s not working. I have a boolean, in my InterfaceManager class, called “chatboxInterDisplayed()” and I took that in the WorldPacketsDecoder class and put the following:

if (player.getInterfaceManager().chatboxInterDisplayed() && packetId != MINI_WALKING_PACKET) { return; }

And I put it at the top of the correct method, decodeLogicPackets, before all other packets are decoded. But it still doesn’t work. Any help? Thanks

Read full topic
